description: This dataset contains neighborhood variables gathered from the American Community Survey (ACS) from 2019 to 2022. It includes data related to commuting patterns, such as car usage and average travel time to work, providing insights into neighborhood-level transportation behaviors at the Census tract level.
source: American Community Survey 5-year data - U.S. Census Bureau

variables.name: no_vehicle_p
variables.description: Percentage of occupied housing units with no vehicles available
variables.units: Percentage out of total occupied housing units in geography

variables.name: mean_travel_time
variables.description: Mean travel time to work for workers 16 years and over (in minutes)

variables.name: vacant_units_p
variables.description: Percent of vacant housing units out of total housing units in geography

variables.name: owner_occupied_p
variables.description: MPercent of owner-occupied housing units out of total occupied housing units in geography

notes: GEOIDs correspond to Census tracts for the given year of the dataset. Note that Census tract boundaries have changed after the 2020 decennial census, which may affect geographic consistency over time.
